feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Flood Advisory issued December 05 at 2:03PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: .Warm temperatures have caused ice movement across parts of the Kuskokwim Basin. This has resulted in swiftly moving ice jams and flooding of nearby areas from ice action. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR AN ICE JAM IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM AKST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by an ice jam is occurring.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Kuskokwim Delta

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 05 at 3:22AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Elevated Sea Levels Sunday Night Through Tuesday... Water levels continue to rise along the Arctic Coast from Utqiagvik west. The highest water levels are expected to occur Monday Night and Tuesday morning. Water may push up on top of the sea ice, and could cause ice to pile up on beaches from Utqiagvik west. No infrastructure flooding is expected at this time.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Northern Arctic Coast; Western Arctic Coast

entry.title: Flood Warning issued December 06 at 3:44AM CST until December 08 at 8:40AM CST by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Alabama... Paint Rock River NEAR Woodville affecting Jackson, Madison and Marshall Counties. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO THURSDAY
entry.cap:areaDesc: Jackson; Madison; Marshall

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 05 at 9:08PM MST until December 06 at 6:00AM MST by NWS
entry.summary: .Moderate to briefly heavy snow is expected Monday night across the higher elevations in the mountains, including the I-70 corridor from Vail Pass to Silver Plume. The heaviest banded snow is likely to only last for a couple hours, but light snow is expected to continue through Tuesday. This will produce slick travel conditions, with the worst conditions occurring near or a little before sunrise for the
entry.cap:areaDesc: West Jackson and West Grand Counties Above 9000 Feet

entry.title: Flood Warning issued December 05 at 8:40PM EST until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... St Johns River Near Astor affecting Volusia and Lake Counties. .The Saint Johns River at Astor remains in Minor Flood stage. entry.summary: ...COASTAL FLOOD STATEMENT IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Up to one half foot of inundation above ground level expected along shorelines and tidal waterways (6.9 to 7.1 feet Mean Lower Low Water at Charleston). * WHERE...Coastal Colleton and Charleston Counties.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 06 at 1:07AM CST by NWS
entry.summary: ...AREAS OF FOG EARLY THIS MORNING... Areas of fog continue to develop across portions of the Brush Country and Rio Grande Plains early this morning. entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 05 at 7:38PM PST until December 06 at 12:00PM PST by NWS
entry.summary: ...FREEZING DRIZZLE THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING... .A mix of freezing drizzle and flurries will develop through tonight into Tuesday morning from the Palouse to northeast Washington and into the Idaho Panhandle. A light glaze of ice will make for slick travel conditions and walking surfaces. The Tuesday morning commute will likely be impacted.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Northeast Mountains; Spokane Area; Washington Palouse

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 06 at 1:45AM EST until December 06 at 8:00AM EST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Areas of freezing rain. Ice accumulations of a light glaze. * WHERE...In Maryland, Allegany County. In West Virginia, Hampshire and Mineral Counties.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Eastern Mineral; Hampshire; Western Mineral

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 06 at 2:19AM MST by NWS
entry.summary: West to southwest winds sustained 30 to 40 MPH with gusts up to 55 MPH will continue overnight along Interstate 25 between Mile Markers 68 and 75. Those traveling in light weight and high profile vehicles are urged to use caution along Interstate 25 between Chugwater and Wheatland.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 06 at 1:03AM MST until December 06 at 8:00AM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM MST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow. Additional snow accumulations of up to one inch. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches. Winds gusting as high as 35 MPH. * WHERE...Sierra Madre Range and Snowy Range.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Sierra Madre Range; Snowy Range

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 05 at 7:49PM MST by NWS
